author: Andrew Greif
description: From Coco Gauff to Alexander Zverev, Wimbledon's first round saw many of the world's best tennis players lose. "It's kind of shocking," one top player said.
title: Why so many top tennis stars are losing early at Wimbledon

author: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
description: Rob McElhenney isn’t making any apologies over his decision to change his name, but he is making a few jokes about it
title: Rob McElhenney defends name change in cheeky video

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: PhD student Job Garcia was tackled by agents, arrested and held in detention after filming an immigration raid at Home Depot, according to the legal group MALDEF.
title: U.S. citizen seeks $1M after arrest, detention for recording immigration raid at Home Depot

author: Scott Stump, TODAY
description: A one-of-a-kind gift once owned by her late mother left Mariska Hargitay speechless and emotional after it was presented to the television star by her older brother
title: Mariska Hargitay’s gifted sinks from Jayne Mansfield’s home in 'My Mom Jayne' deleted scene

author: Scott Stump, TODAY
description: Chuck E. Cheese wants to make sure the grown-ups have fun, too
title: Chuck E. Cheese has launched a new arcade, and it's for adults

author: Becca Wood, TODAY
description: While Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce has been known to make touchdowns on the field, he’s been trying his luck at scoring off the field in the world of acting
title: Travis Kelce opens up about how reading challenges affected his 'SNL' debut

author: The Politics Desk
description: In today’s edition, our White House team dives into the informal and unorthodox way President Donald Trump holds court in the Oval Office. Plus, Andrea Mitchell marks the demise of USAID.
title: Trump's freewheeling and unorthodox West Wing: From the Politics Desk

description: Following his acquittal on racketeering and sex trafficking charges, Sean “Diddy” Combs was found guilty of transporting former girlfriends for prostitution. A judge denied bail, and Combs will remain in custody until sentencing.
title: Judge denies bail for Sean 'Diddy' Combs

author: Daniel Arkin
description: The jury in Sean 'Diddy' Combs' trial ultimately rejected prosecutors’ assertion that the hip-hop mogul ran a racketeering and sex-trafficking scheme.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs verdict is a blow to federal prosecutors, analysts say

author: Kaitlin Sullivan
description: Recreational use of nitrous oxide — often referred to as whippets or laughing gas — left a 23-year-old with frostbite in his mouth and throat, according to a report of the man’s case published Wednesday in the New England Journal of Medicine
title: A chilling risk of recreational nitrous oxide use: Frostbite

author: Shannon Pettypiece
description: President Donald Trump’s trade war risks reigniting next week when a temporary pause on sweeping tariffs is set to expire, potentially driving up costs for businesses and raising prices for consumers
title: Trump's tariff pause is set to expire, threatening a trade war flare-up

author: Kimmy Yam
description: A Purple Heart veteran who self-deported to South Korea last week after being targeted with detention and deportation says that he believes his diagnosed PTSD has worsened since arriving in a country he hasn’t been to in decades.
title: A Purple Heart vet who self-deported to Korea says he feels his PTSD is now worse

author: Briana Trujillo
description: A mother is charged with first-degree murder in the drowning death of her 4-year-old daughter in El Portal, according to the Miami-Dade Sheriff’s Office (MDSO).Dr.
title: Doctor charged with murder in 4-year-old daughter's drowning, sheriff's office says

author: Kamaron McNair, CNBC
description: The Senate narrowly passed its spending megabill on Tuesday night.
title: Student loan borrowers will have fewer repayment options under GOP megabill

author: Reuters
description: U.S. District Judge Randolph Moss said he would pause the effective date of his order for 14 days to allow the Trump administration to appeal his ruling.
title: Judge blocks Trump's asylum ban at southern border, says he exceeded authority

author: Amelia Lucas, CNBC
description: Constellation Brands on Tuesday reported quarterly earnings and revenue that missed analysts’ estimates as beer demand slid and tariffs on aluminum weighed on its profitability
title: Tariffs and weaker beer demand are weighing on Modelo owner Constellation Brands

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: WASHINGTON — A Jan. 6 defendant who plotted to murder FBI special agents who investigated him over his actions at the Capitol was sentenced to life in prison on Wednesday
title: Jan. 6 defendant sentenced to life in prison for plotting to kill FBI special agents who investigated him

author: The Associated Press
description: Virginia officials have agreed not to fully enforce a 2020 law banning conversion therapy for minors as part of an agreement with a faith-based conservative group that sued over the law.
title: Virginia agrees not to fully enforce state law banning conversion therapy for LGBTQ minors

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: The New York Knicks are set to hire two-time NBA Coach of the Year Mike Brown as their head coach, according to multiple reports
title: Knicks expected to hire Mike Brown as next head coach, reports say

author: Jordan Novet, CNBC
description: Microsoft said Wednesday that it will lay off about 9,000 employees.
title: Microsoft laying off about 9,000 employees in latest round of cuts

author: Alex Harring, CNBC
description: Private sector hiring unexpectedly contracted in June, payrolls processing firm ADP said Wednesday, in a possible sign that the economy may not be as sturdy as investors believe as they bid the S&P 500 back up to record territory to end the month
title: The private sector lost 33,000 jobs in June, badly missing expectations for a 100,000 increase, ADP says

author: Diana Olick, CNBC
description: Mortgage rates fell last week to the lowest level since April, leading current homeowners to seek savings
title: Mortgage refinance demand surges, as interest rates drop further

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: ICEBlock, launched in April, encourages users to “see something, tap something” when they see ICE agents nearby.
title: App that allows people to share ICE sightings gets boost in downloads after White House backlash

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: El Salvador native Mario Guevara was arrested while covering a "No Kings" protest and then turned over to ICE detention, where he's been placed in deportation proceedings.
title: ICE-detained journalist bonds out after arrest while reporting on 'No Kings' protests

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: The former artist manager led the U.S. branch of the renowned South Korean entertainment group for four years.
title: Scooter Braun to step down as CEO of Hybe America

description: Bryan Kohberger repeatedly answered "yes" when asked if he stabbed four University of Idaho students "deliberately with premeditation and malice of forethought" by the judge overseeing his case.
title: Watch: Kohberger answers 'yes' when asked if he stabbed University of Idaho students

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Revelers traveling for July Fourth festivities may face delays due to stormy weather as the country braces for the busiest week of Independence Day air travel in 15 years
title: Travelers face potential storm-related delays over July Fourth week

author: The Associated Press
description: The U.S. government is preparing to breed billions of flies and dump them out of airplanes over Mexico and southern Texas to fight a flesh-eating maggot.
title: U.S. plans to begin breeding billions of flies to fight a pest

author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers
title: Inside the courtroom, tension and anxiety before Diddy trial verdict was read

description: Defense attorney Misty Marris breaks down how the civil lawsuits filed against Sean "Diddy" Combs will be influenced by the verdict in his criminal case and the lower burden that those lawsuits carry.
title: How Sean 'Diddy' Combs' verdict could impact pending civil cases

description: Watch live coverage as Bryan Kohberger enters an expected guilty plea in the murder of four University of Idaho students. The plea deal is expected to spare Kohberger the death penalty.
title: Bryan Kohberger enters plea in murder of Idaho college students

author: Sahil Kapur
description: House Republican leaders are moving rapidly on Wednesday to try to pass the party's massive domestic policy package after the Senate approved it, launching a full-court press and enlisting the help of President Donald Trump to sway a broad group of holdouts.
title: Republicans scramble to corral support for Trump megabill ahead of House vote

description: After Sean “Diddy” Combs was found not guilty on three of the five charges against him, attorney Misty Marris weighs in on what his sentencing could look like and if he could face more jail time.
title: How Might Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Be Sentenced After Verdicts?

description: After being found not guilty of racketeering and sex trafficking charges and guilty on two lesser counts, the verdict is seen as a victory for Sean "Diddy" Combs — but how could his reputation be impacted? NBC legal analyst Kristen Gibbons Feden weighs in.
title: Are Mixed Verdicts a 'Victory' for Sean 'Diddy' Combs?

author: Rob Wile
description: President Donald Trump wants the U.S. to increase its exports and lower its imports.
title: The U.S. dollar has fallen to its lowest value since 1973. Here's what that means.

description: NBC’s Chloe Melas breaks down what’s going on inside the courtroom after Sean “Diddy” Combs was found guilty of two of the five charges against him.
title: Sean Combs Verdict: What’s the Reaction in the Courtroom?

description: After three days of deliberations in the Sean "Diddy" Combs trial, the jury found him guilty on two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution and not guilty on the racketeering and sex trafficking charges.
title: Jury Finds Sean 'Diddy' Combs Guilty on 2 of 5 Charges

author: Adam Reiss
description: Sean “Diddy” Combs, the one-time global hip-hop titan whose criminal trial unveiled harrowing testimony accusing him of sexual abuse against women and forced drug-dazed “freak offs,” was acquitted Wednesday on racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking but found guilty of lesser charges in his federal trial.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs found not guilty of racketeering and sex trafficking, but convicted of lesser charges

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: A heatwave blasted Europe on Wednesday as several countries, including France, Italy and Spain, issued heat alerts..
title: As Europe swelters in extreme heat, Eiffel Tower closes its top level and a Swiss reactor shuts down

author: Adam Edelman
description: The Wisconsin Supreme Court on Wednesday formally struck down an abortion ban from 1849 that had technically retaken effect after the U.S.
title: Wisconsin Supreme Court strikes down state's 1849 near-total abortion ban

author: The Associated Press
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Day camp providers and schools are warning that a Trump administration funding freeze could wreck summer for low-income American families and wipe out some after-school programming next year
title: Trump administration withholds over $6 billion for after-school, summer programs and more

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Flint has replaced most of its lead water pipes, more than ten years after contaminated water was found in the Michigan city's water system, prompting national outrage
title: Flint replaces most lead pipes, 10 years after the Michigan water crisis

author: Tom Costello
description: Researchers on Wednesday announced a new expedition to find ​​Amelia Earhart’s plane, based on evidence that suggests the famed aviator may have crash-landed on a remote island in the South Pacific.
title: Researchers announce new effort to find Amelia Earhart's plane

description: Amelia Earhart and her navigator Fred Noonan disappeared while trying to fly around the world back in 1937. Now, Purdue University is announcing a new effort to find the lost plane after a satellite photo of a remote island lagoon is getting renewed attention. NBC’s Tom Costello reports for TODAY.
title: Inside the New Push to Find the Missing Plane of Amelia Earhart

author: Arturo Conde
description: The animated show of the 7-year-old adventurous girl with her signature purple backpack comes to life in “Dora and the Search for Sol Dorado” on Nickelodeon and Paramount+.
title: 'Dora the Explorer' live-action movie celebrates 25th anniversary of beloved series

description: Paramount, the parent company of CBS’s “60 Minutes,” has agreed to pay $16 million to settle a lawsuit brought by President Donald Trump over the handling of an interview with Kamala Harris. NBC News' Peter Alexander reports on the details of the settlement and what Paramount has promised to do in future presidential candidate interviews.
title: Paramount agrees to pay $16 million to settle Trump's '60 Minutes' lawsuit

description: President Donald Trump’s so-called Big Beautiful Bill heads to the House of Representatives after narrowly passing through the Senate on Tuesday with a tie breaking vote from Vice President JD Vance. After Republican Senators made changes to get it through, the bill now faces a potential uphill battle in Trump’s own party with some moderators worrying there are too many cuts and other Republican headliners in the House thinking the changes weaken the cuts they want. NBC’s Ryan Nobles repor
title: Senate Narrowly Approves Trump's Spending Bill, Heads to House

description: The jury in the Sean “Diddy” Combs trial told the judge on Tuesday it has reached a verdict on four of the five counts, but is unable to reach a consensus on the racketeering conspiracy charge. For that count, the jury must decide whether Combs ran a criminal organization and committed underlying crimes like kidnapping and arson. NBC’s Chloe Melas reports and legal analyst Misty Marris joins TODAY with analysis.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Jurors Reach Verdict on 4 of 5 Charges

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: The Republican-led House seeks to pass the bill for Donald Trump’s agenda before the end of the week.
title: House debates Trump's agenda bill and Pentagon pauses Ukraine shipment: Morning Rundown

description: The jury said Tuesday it reached verdicts on four sex trafficking counts, but couldn't agree on a racketeering charge.
title: Verdict reached in trial of Sean 'Diddy' Combs

author: The Associated Press
description: NEW YORK — A federal judge in New York on Tuesday blocked the Trump administration from ending temporary legal status for more than 500,000 Haitians who are already in the United States
title: Federal judge blocks Trump administration from ending temporary legal status for many Haitians

author: The Associated Press
description: State and federal authorities are investigating an online company that pledges to help people find their eternal love, Michigan’s attorney general said Tuesday.
title: Michigan attorney general says she is investigating a company promoting 'twin flame' romance

author: NBC Dallas-Fort Worth staff
description: Four members of the McKellar family from Fort Worth were killed, and one remains in critical condition, after Texas DPS says a big rig driver fell asleep at the wheel Saturday afternoon in Kaufman County and collided with stopped traffic
title: Texas truck crash kills four members of the same Fort Worth family

author: The Associated Press
description: More than 60 years after a white supremacist assassinated civil rights leader Medgar Evers, his daughter still sees the same strain of political violence at work in American society.
title: Daughter of assassinated civil rights leader sees painful echoes of political violence in America

author: Peter Nicholas
description: Trump likes to see whom he wants and call whom he chooses, and in the new term, he presides over a White House that mirrors the man, current and former aides say.
title: Fox News, MAGA hats and cookies: Inside Trump's West Wing

author: The Associated Press
description: The move follows a law passed by Iran’s parliament last week, after American airstrikes hit Iran's most-important nuclear facilities.
title: Iran's president reportedly suspends cooperation with U.N. nuclear watchdog

author: Jennifer Jett
description: The Dalai Lama said on Wednesday that the ancient Tibetan Buddhist institution he leads will live on after he dies, putting an end to speculation that he would be the last person to hold the role as he plans to reincarnate.
title: The Dalai Lama signals China should stay out of divine succession process

author: Rudy Chinchilla
description: Paramount has agreed to pay $16 million to settle a lawsuit brought by President Donald Trump that had alleged an interview that aired on CBS’s “60 Minutes” last year with Kamala Harris, his Democratic opponent for the presidency, was deceptively edited
title: Paramount agrees to pay $16 million to settle Trump's lawsuit over '60 Minutes' Kamala Harris interview

author: Tim Stelloh
description: The man accused of fatally stabbing four college students at an off-campus home in Idaho three years ago appears to have agreed to plead guilty to the murders
title: What to know about Bryan Kohberger's apparent plea deal in the University of Idaho murders

author: Phil Helsel
description: A warehouse storing fireworks in California caught fire and exploded Tuesday, sending a fireball into the air, launching debris and causing pyrotechnics to detonate above the site, according to officials and video from the scene
title: California fireworks warehouse catches fire and explodes

author: Matt Dixon
description: There was no evidence of the onetime rivalry between Trump and Gov. Ron DeSantis as they came together for the opening of the "Alligator Alcatraz" immigrant detention center.
title: 'You'll always be my friend': Trump and Ron DeSantis put aside rivalry at 'Alligator Alcatraz'

author: The Associated Press
description: The Cuban women's national volleyball team was denied a chance to play in a tournament in Puerto Rico following the new visa restrictions imposed by U.S.
title: Cuban women's volleyball team denied U.S. visa to compete in Puerto Rico

author: The Associated Press
description: Rap-punk duo Bob Vylan on Tuesday rejected claims of antisemitism over onstage comments at the Glastonbury Festival that triggered a police investigation and sparked criticism from politicians, the BBC and festival organizers.
title: Rap-punk duo Bob Vylan says it's being targeted for speaking up about Gaza at Glastonbury
